Posts.Content: YHong wrote: Hi everyone, My mom is not doing well.  She started to feel a little "bloated" about two weeks ago and recently I have noticed that her tummy has gotten big.  Her onc thinks that she is getting ascites from her liver mets.  At first he wanted to give her vinorelbine, then last week, he decided to give her Carboplatin and tykerb.  But it's not helping her much, she is still very tired all the time and eats very little.  Is this a sign that her liver is going into failure???  I am so scared right now.  Is there anything we can do?  I am hoping for a miracle.  Yhong Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: YHong wrote: Hi, My mom's onc will be changing her chemo from taxol to vinorelbine next week.  She had seven rounds of taxol (weekly x 3 and 1 week off) and it looks like she is having some progression (TM went up, it was stable before).  He told us that she has to get a port-a-cath in order to get the new chemo, just wondering what to expect with that procedure and what are the side effects for vinorelbine.  Thanks. Posts.Title: vinorelbine and port placement YHong YHong

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2008 12:45AM YHong wrote: Thanks for the info ladies.  My mom has not had a scan for two months, but her TM went up and she is getting some ascites in her belly, and her liver enzyme also went up, hence the change in her chemo.  She will get port on Monday and her first time getting vinorelbine this coming Wed.  I hope it doesn't do too much damage since Thanksgiving is the next day.  This will be the first time I prepare for this holiday and I am a little anxious about it as well.  I am taking off work on Wed to take her to her appointment so I have to work the graveyard shift on Thanksgiving day....a very stressful week coming up.  Hoping things will turn out ok.  Happy Happy Thanksgiving!!!!  I hope everyone have a safe holiday!

Posts.Title: Off to surgery again.... LuAnnH heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: YHong wrote: Hi ladies, I just came across something called BZL101.  It is a Chinese herbal extract being investigated by Bionovo. Here is the website for the phase I trial: http://www.bionovo.com/media/mediaarchives/Bionovo_Breast_Cancer_Research_Treatment.pdf. In short, it had good activities in vitro with both Her2 neg and pos breast cancer cell lines and seems to be well tolerated by patients.  Almost 50% of the patients that took it had either disease regression or stable disease.  Hope this can be another option down the road. I don't post much, but for those who have read my previous posts, I am here mainly for my mom who is going treatments to liver mets.  I am happy to say that although her tumor markers are still high, her liver did return to the original size since she has been on Taxol/Herceptin.  Although side effects from Taxol is hard for her, especially the diarrhea, but she is fighting on.  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: YHong wrote: There is a new product being developed for Her2+ gals.  Genentech has attached a small molecule that can kill cancer cells to herceptin to make it more specific, hence possible less side effects and possible more effective in treating the cancer.  It's called Trastuzumab-MCC-DM1, and they are recruiting for clinical trials. Here's the link to the clincial trials: http://www.clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT00509769?term=T-DM1&rank=1 Fight on ladies!!! Log in to post a reply
